revision.text:
{{Infobox person | name = Ian Gomez | image = Ian Gomez 2012.jpg | imagesize = 220px | caption = Gomez in 2012 | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1965|12|24}} | birth_place = [[New York City]], [[New York (state)|New York]], U.S. | occupation = [[Actor]] | yearsactive = 1993–present | spouse = {{marriage|[[Nia Vardalos]]
|1994|2018|reason=divorced}} | children = 1 }} '''Ian Gomez''' (born December 24, 1965) is an American actor known for his comedic TV work, which include series-regular stints as Javier on ''[[Felicity (TV series)|Felicity]]'' and Andy on ''[[Cougar Town]]''. ==Early life== He was born in [[New York City, New York]], to an artist father and a dancer mother.{{cite web | url = http://www.filmreference.com/film/51/Ian-Gomez.html | title= Ian Gomez Biography (1964-) | publisher=FilmReference.com | accessdate = 13 March 2013}} ==Career== On ''[[The Drew Carey Show]]'' from 1994–2005, Gomez played Larry Almada, a co-worker of [[Drew Carey]]'s character (also named Drew Carey) at Winfred-Louder. He also worked with Carey in 1999 on the show ''[[Whose Line Is It Anyway? (U.S. TV series)|Whose Line is it Anyway?]]'' From 1998–2002, he played Javier Clemente Quintata on the [[The WB Television Network|WB]] show ''[[Felicity (TV series)|Felicity]]''. In 2002, Gomez starred in [[Alanis Morissette]]'s "Hands Clean" music video. In the same year, he appeared with [[Jeff Garlin|Jeff Greene]], [[Ted Danson]], [[Michael York (actor)|Michael York]], and Hugh Mellon in two episodes of the [[HBO]] series ''[[Curb Your Enthusiasm]]'', where he played the "bald chef", hired by [[Larry David|Larry]] to cook in the restaurant he owned. Gomez appeared in [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]]'s ''[[Jake in Progress]]'' (2005–2006), which starred [[John Stamos]]. 2006 saw Gomez appear in the fourth episode of [[Lost (TV series)|''Lost'''s]] 2006 third season, "[[Every Man for Himself (Lost)|Every Man for Himself]]", and as a therapist in the April 2006 episode "[[List of Reba episodes|Here We Go Again]]" of ''[[Reba (TV series)|Reba]]''. [[File:Nia Vardalos and Ian Gomez (cropped).jpg|thumb|Gomez with wife [[Nia Vardalos]] in 2012]] Gomez took the part of Andy Torres in the [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]] and later [[TBS (U.S. TV channel)|TBS]] comedy ''[[Cougar Town]]'' alongside fellow ''The Drew Carey Show'' castmate [[Christa Miller]], from 2009–2015. In 2016, Gomez and his wife, Nia Vardalos, co-presented ''[[The Great American Baking Show]]'', a revival of ''The Great Holiday Baking Show''.[http://abc.go.com/shows/the-great-american-baking-show/about-the-show The Great American Baking Show (ABC)]; accessed December 9, 2016. ==Personal life== He is married to actress-writer [[Nia Vardalos]] of ''[[My Big Fat Greek Wedding]]'' fame. He appeared in her films ''My Big Fat Greek Wedding'', ''[[Connie and Carla]]'', ''[[My Life in Ruins]]'', ''[[I Hate Valentine's Day]]'', and ''[[My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2]]''. Gomez is of [[Puerto Rican American|Puerto Rican]] and [[History of the Jews in Russia|Russian Jewish]] descent, and converted to the [[Greek Orthodox Church]] upon marrying Vardalos, which is mirrored as a plot element in ''My Big Fat Greek Wedding''. In 2008, the two adopted a daughter.{{cite web|title=ZMTV - Ian Gomez from Cougar Town Interview|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1kjg9xLd6H0|website=YouTube|date=20 July 2010}}https://www.gov.mb.ca/iedm/archive/people/vardalos.html{{dead url|date=February 2018}}{{cite news|last1=Failla|first1=Annemarie|title=Nia Vardalos My Big Fat Greek Wedding|url=https://www.femail.com.au/niavardalos.htm|accessdate=12 February 2018|work=www.femail.com.au|language=en}} It was announced on July 3, 2018 that Vardalos filed for divorce from Gomez after 23 years of marriage due to irreconcilable differences.{{cite web|url=https://www.eonline.com/news/949161/nia-vardalos-files-for-divorce-from-ian-gomez-after-23-years-of-marriage|title=Nia Vardalos Files for Divorce From Ian Gomez After 23 Years of Marriage|publisher=eonline.com|author=Mike Vulpo|date=2018-07-03|accessdate=2018-07-03}} ==Filmography== ===Film=== {| class="wikitable sortable" ! Year ! Title !
